column4: Not 'As Seen on TV': Snuggie maker sues Amazon.com
column5: NEW YORK Makers of the Snuggie blanket and other products sold mainly on TV have sued Amazon.com Inc  accusing the internet retailer of trademark infringement for letting an "astronomical" number of counterfeit products to be sold through its website.

column4: Apple Watch sales to consumers set record in holiday week  says Apple's Cook
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Sales of the Apple Watch to consumers set a record during the first week of holiday shopping  and the current quarter is on track to be the best ever for the product  Apple Inc  Chief Executive Tim Cook told Reuters. | Video

column4: California EPA says settled with Apple on hazardous waste claims
column5: The California Environmental Protection Agency on Tuesday said Apple Inc agreed to pay $450 000 to settle state claims that it had mishandled hazardous electronic waste at facilities in Silicon Valley.

column4: Cyber security start-up Secdo raises $10 million
column5: TEL AVIV Secdo has raised $10 million in a funding round led by RDC  a subsidiary of Israel's Elron Electronic Industries and Rafael  Check Point Software co-founder Marius Nacht  and the founders of Anobit  which was acquired by Apple.

column4: Trump's corporate tax holiday could spur pharma M&A
column5: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's plan to incentivize U.S. companies to repatriate their swelling overseas cash piles could spur a new wave of dealmaking in a pharmaceutical industry seeking to buy its way into growth.

column2: Barclays Inverse US Treasury Composite ETN
column4: Barclays' exit from energy trading stirs concerns over liquidity
column5: NEW YORK British bank Barclays Plc has joined the list of top banks to exit energy trading  an exodus that analysts say raises concern among oil producers that falling liquidity means they cannot use derivatives for their basic function: to hedge risk by locking in future prices.

column4: Hedge fund takes Buffalo Wild Wings fight to franchisees
column5: BOSTON Hedge fund manager Mick McGuire is taking his fight for change at casual restaurant chain Buffalo Wild Wings Inc directly to franchise owners  saying they could have better access to innovations and grow more if his ideas were implemented.

column4: Caesars unit's bank lenders threaten to end bankruptcy deal
column5: CHICAGO The bank lenders of Caesars Entertainment Corp's  operating unit said they might walk away from a plan to bring the casino unit out of its $18 billion bankruptcy  potentially sending a high-stakes reorganization plan into disarray.

column4: Verizon to sell data centers to Equinix for $3.6 billion
column5: Verizon Communications Inc   the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier  is selling 29 data centers in the United States and Latin America to Equinix Inc  for $3.6 billion  as the telecom giant focuses on its core business.

column4: Ex-Expedia IT employee pleads guilty to insider trading
column5: A former Expedia Inc computer support technician pleaded guilty on Monday to having secretly accessed senior executives' emails in order to engage in insider trading based on confidential information he stole.

column4: Norway's Schibsted to hire more staff to stave off Facebook in classified ads
column5: OSLO Norwegian media group Schibsted plans to add 200 people to its 1 800-strong technology team in the next year to further develop its online classified ads business and fend off competition from Facebook  its chief executive says.

column4: Lawmakers ask U.S. to block Chinese takeover of Lattice Semiconductor
column5: WASHINGTON More than 20 U.S. Congress members wrote to U.S. Treasury Secretary Jack Lew on Monday asking for the acquisition of U.S. chip maker Lattice Semiconductor Corp  by a fund with ties to China's government to be blocked over security concerns.

column4: Microsoft gains EU approval for $26 billion buy of LinkedIn
column5: BRUSSELS Microsoft  won EU antitrust approval on Tuesday for its $26 billion bid for professional social network LinkedIn   its largest ever acquisition  after agreeing to a series of modest concessions.

column4: Software maker Synchronoss to buy Intralinks for $821 million
column5: Synchronoss Technologies Inc   which makes customer service software for mobile carriers  said on Tuesday it would buy cloud-based business software provider Intralinks Holdings Inc  for $821 million in cash.

column4: For a change  Delaware plaintiffs' bar gets good news in Zynga opinion
column5: These are not happy days for plaintiffs' lawyers who practice in Delaware. Chancery Court has pretty much shut down the controversial but lucrative “deal tax” business of suing to block announced M&A deals  then settling cases for a few hundred thousand bucks in legal fees and some immaterial proxy disclosures. The Delaware Supreme Court  meanwhile  added to the pain when it ruled in Corwin v. KKR that corporate boards’ M&A decisions are entitled to deference when informed shareholde

column4: Keter backs ABM Italia buy with €300m of additional loans
column5: LONDON Israeli furniture maker Keter Group’s acquisition of Italian plastic furniture manufacturer ABM Italia will be backed with a €300m ($322 million) leveraged loan  banking sources said on Tuesday.

column4: Mexico's America Movil to provide national roaming service to Telefonica Mexico
column5: MEXICO CITY Mexican telecoms giant America Movil   controlled by tycoon Carlos Slim  said on Monday its Mexican unit had reached an agreement to provide a national roaming service to its main competitor in the local market  Telefonica Mexico.

column4: Mexico's America Movil to provide national roaming service to Telefonica Mexico
column5: MEXICO CITY Mexican telecoms giant America Movil   controlled by tycoon Carlos Slim  said on Monday its Mexican unit had reached an agreement to provide a national roaming service to its main competitor in the local market  Telefonica Mexico.

column4: AstraZeneca pill slashes lung cancer progression in study
column5: LONDON AstraZeneca's pill Tagrisso cut the risk of lung cancer progressing by 70 percent compared to standard chemotherapy in a major clinical trial  lifting prospects for a drug that is key to the company's lofty long-term sales goals.

column4: DirecTV Now streaming television exceeding expectations: AT&T CEO
column5: NEW YORK AT&T Inc's new streaming television service  DirectTV Now  has so far exceeded expectations  AT&T's CEO Randall Stephenson told investors on Tuesday.

column4: Barclays' exit from energy trading stirs concerns over liquidity
column5: NEW YORK British bank Barclays Plc has joined the list of top banks to exit energy trading  an exodus that analysts say raises concern among oil producers that falling liquidity means they cannot use derivatives for their basic function: to hedge risk by locking in future prices.

column4: Barrick Gold says Latam key to growth as it adds director
column5: Latin America will play an increasingly important role in Barrick Gold's growth strategy  the world's biggest gold miner said on Tuesday as it named a new director with decades of mining experience in that region.

column4: Mexico's Pemex sees more tie-ups after first joint venture
column5: MEXICO CITY Fresh off a historic tie-up with Australia's BHP Billiton Plc  Pemex [PEMX.UL] is aiming for more than five additional joint ventures with other major producers over the next two years  the chief executive officer of the Mexican state oil firm said on Monday.

column4: Boeing says current Air Force One contract worth $170 million
column5: SIMI VALLEY  Calif. Boeing Co on Tuesday responded to a call by President-elect Donald Trump about the costs of a new Air Force One  saying that it currently had only a $170 million contract to determine the capabilities of the new presidential aircraft.

column4: Boeing expects business jet sales to recover in next two years
column5: DUBAI Boeing  sees sales of its business jets rebounding over the next two years after a "tough" 2016  Boeing Business Jet President David Longridge said at a press conference in Dubai on Tuesday.

column4: Chipotle says new director slate due 'shortly ' recovery lags
column5: LOS ANGELES Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc   amid activist pressure to revamp its board and revive sales following last year's string of food safety lapses  will "shortly" announce a new slate of directors  founder and co-chief executive Steve Ells said on Tuesday.

column4: Exxon Baton Rouge refinery alkylation unit remains shut: sources
column5: HOUSTON An alkylation unit remained shut on Tuesday at ExxonMobil Corp's 502 500 barrel per day (bpd) Baton Rouge refinery after a fire halted that unit's operations nearly two weeks ago  said sources familiar with plant operations.

column4: Ford stockpiles best-selling F-150 trucks to test new transmission
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co  is stockpiling 2017 model F-150 trucks  delaying delivery to dealers while it runs final tests on a new 10-speed transmission  a top executive told Reuters.

column4: GE Power sees little sales impact if U.S. quits climate deals
column5: (Story corrects to 1 billion tonnes from 1 million in sixth paragraph.)

column4: GE Power sees little sales impact if U.S. quits climate deals
column5: (Story corrects to 1 billion tonnes from 1 million in sixth paragraph.)

column4: GE Power sees little sales impact if U.S. quits climate deals
column5: (Story corrects to 1 billion tonnes from 1 million in sixth paragraph.)

column4: GE Power sees little sales impact if U.S. quits climate deals
column5: (Story corrects to 1 billion tonnes from 1 million in sixth paragraph.)

column4: GoDaddy to buy Host Europe for $1.82 billion
column5: GoDaddy Inc   a U.S.-based website domain name provider   said on Tuesday it would buy peer Host Europe Group (HEG) for 1.69 billion euros ($1.82 billion)  including debt  as it seeks to expand beyond the initial set-up of websites.

column4: JPMorgan CEO says bank may look to pay special dividend
column5: NEW YORK The stock of JPMorgan Chase & Co  has been climbing so much that "at a certain price " the company may consider issuing a special dividend to distribute excess capital rather than buying back additional stock  Chief Executive Jamie Dimon said on Tuesday.

column4: Top Actelion shareholder says backs J&J deal above 246 Sfr/share
column5: LONDON A top-30 investor in Swiss pharmaceutical company Actelion  said he would back a takeover approach for the whole company from U.S. rival Johnson & Johnson  above 246 Swiss francs.

column4: Trump's corporate tax holiday could spur pharma M&A
column5: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's plan to incentivize U.S. companies to repatriate their swelling overseas cash piles could spur a new wave of dealmaking in a pharmaceutical industry seeking to buy its way into growth.

column4: Sanofi exploring bid for Actelion amid J&J talks: Bloomberg
column5: French drugmaker Sanofi  is considering a bid for Swiss biotech company Actelion   rivaling an offer made by U.S. healthcare company Johnson & Johnson   Bloomberg reported.

column4: KKR to buy majority stake in cybersecurity firm Optiv from Blackstone
column5: Private equity firm KKR & Co  said on Tuesday it would acquire a majority stake in cybersecurity company Optiv Security Inc  which is majority owned by Blackstone Group LP .

column4: Mastercard to buy back shares worth $4 billion
column5: Payment processor Mastercard Inc  said on Tuesday it would buy back class A shares worth $4 billion and raised its quarterly dividend.

column4: Exclusive: McDonald's to keep up to 25 percent stake in China  HK stores - source
column5: HONG KONG McDonald's Corp  is looking to raise $1 billion to $2 billion with the sale of its China and Hong Kong stores after the U.S. fast-food chain decided to keep "a significant minority stake in the business " a person with direct knowledge of the plans said on Tuesday.

column4: Novartis' drug tops chemotherapy in untreated lung cancer patients
column5: Novartis AG said its cancer drug  Zykadia  was twice as effective as chemotherapy in slowing the progression of a rare form of lung cancer in a late-stage study.

column4: Exclusive: Novartis in talks to sell some central nervous system drugs - sources
column5: ZURICH Novartis is in talks about the sale of some older neuroscience drugs  people close to the matter said  as the Swiss drugmaker clears the decks to concentrate on promising new medicines it hopes will help to restore sales growth.

column4: Brazil court blocks sale of Petrobras fuels distribution unit
column5: SAO PAULO A Brazilian federal court issued an injunction to block the sale of the fuels distribution unit of state oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA (Petrobras) after a request by workers  according to the court's press office.

column4: Philip Morris seeks U.S. approval to market alternative cigarette
column5: Philip Morris International Inc  filed a much-awaited U.S. application to market a new type of cigarette that heats rather than burns tobacco and may carry fewer health risks.

column4: Companies need to work harder to gain societies' trust-Rio chairman
column5: LONDON Multinational companies need to do more to gain the trust of wider society  including better explaining why top executives are so highly rewarded in comparison to workers  the chairman of global miner Rio Tinto  told British lawmakers.

column4: Roper Technologies to buy software firm Deltek in $2.8 billion deal
column5: IT services provider Roper Technologies Inc said it would buy business software company Deltek [THBVOK.UL] from private equity firm Thoma Bravo in a cash deal valued at $2.8 billion.

column4: Sanofi exploring bid for Actelion amid J&J talks: Bloomberg
column5: French drugmaker Sanofi  is considering a bid for Swiss biotech company Actelion   rivaling an offer made by U.S. healthcare company Johnson & Johnson   Bloomberg reported.

column4: Statoil drops Airbus Super Puma helicopters for good
column5: OSLO Norwegian state-controlled oil company Statoil  will not resume using Airbus's  H225 Super Puma helicopters even if Norway's Civil Aviation Authority decides to lift a ban imposed after a fatal crash off Norway in April  the company said on Tuesday.

column4: Statoil CEO sees oil market rebalancing sooner  price heading towards $60
column5: OSLO The balance between demand and supply in the oil market will shift earlier than previously expected due to OPEC's output cuts  with prices heading towards $60 a barrel next year  Statoil's chief executive said on Tuesday.

column4: Oil firm Statoil makes first investment in solar tech
column5: OSLO Norwegian oil major Statoil  has made its first investment in solar power technology  stepping up efforts to gradually complement its petroleum portfolio with renewable assets  the company said on Tuesday.

column4: Statoil to drill offshore Mexico in 2018 at earliest
column5: OSLO Statoil could drill its first well in the Salina Basin offshore Mexico in 2018 at the earliest  its exploration chief told Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: Suncor resolves tax dispute with Canada Revenue Agency
column5: Suncor Energy  Canada's largest oil and gas company  said on Monday that it had resolved a dispute with the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) over its income tax treatment from 2007.

column4: Mexico's America Movil to provide national roaming service to Telefonica Mexico
column5: MEXICO CITY Mexican telecoms giant America Movil   controlled by tycoon Carlos Slim  said on Monday its Mexican unit had reached an agreement to provide a national roaming service to its main competitor in the local market  Telefonica Mexico.

column4: Blackstone's Schwarzman sees historic regulatory overhaul from Trump
column5: Blackstone Group LP  Chairman and CEO Steve Schwarzman said on Tuesday he expected to see a "very substantial reversal of regulations of all types " for the financial sector  following Donald Trump's U.S. presidential election victory.

column4: KKR to buy majority stake in cybersecurity firm Optiv from Blackstone
column5: Private equity firm KKR & Co  said on Tuesday it would acquire a majority stake in cybersecurity company Optiv Security Inc  which is majority owned by Blackstone Group LP .

column4: Homebuilder Toll Brothers eyes millennials as revenue growth continues
column5: U.S. luxury homes builder Toll Brothers Inc's  revenue increased more than expected for the fifth straight quarter  boosted by higher home sales and average selling prices  and the company also gave an encouraging outlook.

column4: Toyota to expand hybrid system development to further cut emissions
column5: TOKYO Toyota Motor Corp said on Tuesday it will expand the development of its gasoline-hybrid technology over the next five years to speed up the introduction of lower-emission engines in the face of stricter global emissions standards.

column4: UTC CEO says no 'quid pro quo' on keeping Indiana plant open
column5: WASHINGTON United Technologies Corp   parent company of Carrier Corp  got a "good deal" with President-elect Donald Trump that allowed it to shift most jobs at two Indiana plants to Mexico  its chief executive said on Monday in an interview with CNBC.

column4: Verizon to sell data centers to Equinix for $3.6 billion
column5: Verizon Communications Inc   the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier  is selling 29 data centers in the United States and Latin America to Equinix Inc  for $3.6 billion  as the telecom giant focuses on its core business.

column5: Verizon Communications Inc   the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier  is selling 29 data centers in the United States and Latin America to Equinix Inc  for $3.6 billion  as the telecom giant focuses on its core business.
